title: Complete SCM Workflow

title: Complete SCM Workflow
text: stepwise covariate modeling (SCM/SCM+) process consists : 0. Backward elimination :Remove non-significant covariates (optional) 1. Forward Selection: Add covariates improve model fit 2. Backward Elimination: Remove non-significant covariates 3. Final Model: Select best parsimonious model

title: Complete SCM Workflow
code: library(CovariateSearcher) library(dplyr)

previous_headings: Complete Stepwise Covariate Modeling Workflow > Step 1: Prepare Your Data
title: Complete SCM Workflow
text: dataset include: - ID: Subject identifier - TIME: Time points - DV: Dependent variable (concentrations) - EVID: Event ID (0=observation, 1=dose) - Covariates (WT, AGE, SEX, etc.)
code: # Example dataset structure head(nonmem_data) #   ID TIME  DV EVID  WT AGE SEX #    1  0.0  NA    1  70  45   1 #    1  0.5 5.2    0  70  45   1 #    1  1.0 8.1    0  70  45   1

previous_headings: Complete Stepwise Covariate Modeling Workflow > Step 1: Prepare Your Data
title: Complete SCM Workflow
text: Create CSV file defining covariates test:
code: # Example: covariate_search.csv covariate_config <- tribble(   ~PARAMETER, ~COVARIATE, ~STATUS,        ~FORMULA, ~LEVELS, ~REFERENCE,   "CL",       "WT",        "continouous",  "power",  NA,      70,   "CL",       "AGE",       "continouous",  "linear", NA,      50,   "CL",       "SEX",       "categorical",  "cat",    "0;1",   1,   "V",        "WT",        "continouous",  "power",  NA,      70 )  write.csv(covariate_config, "data/derived/covariate_search.csv", row.names = FALSE)

title: Complete SCM Workflow
code: search_state <- initialize_covariate_search(   base_model_path = "run10",   data_file_path = "data/derived/analysis.csv",   covariate_search_path = "data/covariate_search.csv",   discover_existing = TRUE,    models_folder = "models",    threads = 40)

title: Complete SCM Workflow
code: # Standard forward selection  results <- full_scm_search(   search_state = search_state,   base_model_id = "run10",   scm_type = "standard",      # or "selective"   starting_phase = "forward",   full_scm = FALSE,           # This runs ONLY forward selection   forward_p_value = 0.05,   rse_threshold = 50,   auto_submit = TRUE,   auto_retry = TRUE )  # Check results print(results$final_model) print(results$selected_covariates)

previous_headings: Complete Stepwise Covariate Modeling Workflow > Step 3: Run Forward Selection
title: Complete SCM Workflow
text: Models selected meet criteria: - Î”OFV > 3.84: Statistically significant improvement (p < 0.05) - RSE < 50%: Parameter estimates reasonably precise

title: Complete SCM Workflow
code: results <- full_scm_search(   search_state = search_state,   base_model_id = "run10",   starting_phase = "backward",   full_scm = FALSE,            # This runs ONLY the specified phase   backward_p_value = 0.01,   auto_submit = TRUE,   auto_retry = TRUE )  print(results$final_model)

title: Generating Parameter Tables with model_report()
text: model_report() function creates professional parameter tables NONMEM model outputs. formats estimates, RSE values, shrinkage publication-ready table.

title: Generating Parameter Tables with model_report()
text: Purpose: Generate formatted parameter comparison tables one models Key Features: - âœ… Formatted parameter names labels YAML specs - âœ… Automatic grouping (typical parameters, IIV, residual error, covariates) - âœ… Side--side comparison multiple models - âœ… Handles failed models gracefully - âœ… Publication-ready flextable output

title: Generating Parameter Tables with model_report()
text: model_report() function uses YAML specification file (pk-extend.yml) format parameter names labels. â€™s pk-extend.yml? file defines parameters displayed: See YAML Specification Files article complete details.
code: library(CovariateSearcher) library(yspec) library(here)  # Load parameter specification file spec_pk <- read_yaml(here("data", "spec", "pk-extend.yml")) CL:   short: CL/F   label: Apparent clearance   unit: L/h V:   short: Vc/F   label: Apparent central volume   unit: L IIV_CL:   short: CL CV%   label: Inter-individual variability on clearance

title: Quick Start Guide
text: minimal vignette included package installation. complete documentation, see online documentation.

previous_headings: CovariateSearcher Quick Start > ğŸ“‹ What You Need
title: Quick Start Guide
text: NONMEM control file properly formatted parameters: Parameter Format: value ; NAME ; units ; RATIO|LOG Important: - $THETA block: Use CL, V (simple names) 1_CL, 2_V (numbered) - $PK/$PRED block: Use TV_CL, TV_V (TV_ prefix) - OMEGA BLOCK: One value per line (multiple values line) - Four fields required: value ; name ; units ; transform âŒ Wrong OMEGA format: âœ… Correct OMEGA format:
code: $THETA ; Simple names (NO TV_ prefix in THETA block!) 0.5 ; CL ; L/h ; RATIO 10  ; V  ; L   ; RATIO  $PK ; Use TV_ prefix HERE in PK block TV_CL = THETA(1) TV_V  = THETA(2)  CL = TV_CL * EXP(ETA(1)) V  = TV_V  * EXP(ETA(2))  $OMEGA BLOCK(2) 0.1 ; IIV_CL   ; ; LOG 0.1 ; IIV_CL_V ; ; LOG 0.1 ; IIV_V    ; ; LOG  $SIGMA 0.1 ; RUV_PROP ; ; LOG $OMEGA BLOCK(2) 0.1     ; IIV_CL    0.1 0.1 ; IIV_V   â† Don't put multiple values per line! $OMEGA BLOCK(2) 0.1 ; IIV_CL   ; ; LOG 0.1 ; IIV_CL_V ; ; LOG 0.1 ; IIV_V    ; ; LOG

title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: CovariateSearcher includes intelligent recovery system automatically handles model estimation failures.

previous_headings: Understanding the Recovery System > How Recovery Works
title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: system monitors several failure indicators: Infinite OFV: OFV > 10^10 Singular Matrix: â€œSINGULAR CONVERGENCE CRITERIAâ€ Error 134: Numerical errors Minimization Failure: â€œMINIMIZATION SUCCESSFULâ€

previous_headings: Understanding the Recovery System > How Recovery Works
title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: failure detected, system:
code: # 1. Marks original model as failed model$status <- "failed"  # 2. Creates retry model with adjusted parameters retry_model <- create_retry_model(   original_model = "run11",   retry_number = 1  # Creates run11001 )  # 3. Adjusts THETA initial estimate # Original: THETA(1) = 0.1 # Retry:    THETA(1) = -0.1  # 4. Submits retry automatically if auto_retry = TRUE

previous_headings: Understanding the Recovery System > Example Recovery Workflow
title: Understanding the Recovery System
code: # Step 1: Original model (run11) fails search_state$search_database %>%   filter(model_name == "run11") #   model_name  status  estimation_issue #   run11       failed  OFV > 10^10  # Step 2: Retry created automatically (run11001) search_state$search_database %>%   filter(model_name == "run11001") #   model_name  status       phase #   run11001    in_progress  retry  # Step 3: If retry succeeds search_state$search_database %>%   filter(model_name == "run11001") #   model_name  status     ofv      delta_ofv #   run11001    completed  1234.5   -5.2

previous_headings: Understanding the Recovery System > Retry Strategies
title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: common issue poor initial estimates. Changing sign often helps:
code: Original THETA: $THETA 0.1  ; AGE on CL  Retry THETA: $THETA -0.1  ; AGE on CL

previous_headings: Understanding the Recovery System > Retry Strategies
title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: retry also fails, covariate relationship may : complex: Try simpler relationship (linear instead power) Collinear: Covariate correlated another model Wrong functional form: Try different relationship type

previous_headings: Understanding the Recovery System > Monitoring Recovery
title: Understanding the Recovery System
code: # View all retry models retries <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(phase == "retry") %>%   arrange(parent_model, model_name)  print(retries)

previous_headings: Understanding the Recovery System > Monitoring Recovery
title: Understanding the Recovery System
code: # Calculate recovery success rate recovery_stats <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(phase == "retry") %>%   count(status) %>%   mutate(rate = n / sum(n))  print(recovery_stats)

title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: prefer manual control:
code: search_state <- initialize_new_search(   base_model_path = "models/run1",   data_file_path = "data/data.csv",   covariate_search_path = "data/covariates.csv",   auto_retry = FALSE  # Disable automatic retry )  # Then manually create retries when needed retry_model <- create_retry_model(   search_state = search_state,   model_name = "run11",   retry_number = 1 )

title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: complex cases, can implement custom recovery:
code: # 1. Identify problematic models failed <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(status == "failed", phase != "retry")  # 2. For each failure, create custom retry for (model in failed$model_name) {   # Read original model   model_path <- file.path(search_state$models_folder, model)      # Custom modifications beyond THETA sign   # - Adjust initial estimates   # - Change estimation method   # - Simplify covariate relationship      # Create modified model   # (custom code here) }

title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: Let auto-retry work first: Usually fixes 60-80% failures Check .lst files: Understand models failed Review base model: Ensure â€™s stable SCM Monitor RSE: High RSE indicates estimation issues Use appropriate thresholds: Î”OFV=3.84, RSE<50% reasonable

title: Understanding the Recovery System
text: Track recovery performance across search:
code: # Summary of all models summary_stats <- search_state$search_database %>%   group_by(phase, status) %>%   summarize(     count = n(),     .groups = "drop"   )  print(summary_stats)  # Successful recovery rate successful_retries <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(phase == "retry", status == "completed") %>%   nrow()  total_retries <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(phase == "retry") %>%   nrow()  cat("Recovery success rate:",      round(100 * successful_retries / total_retries, 1), "%\n")

title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Common issues solutions using CovariateSearcher.

what: Issue: Models fail with â€œMINIMIZATION NOT SUCCESSFULâ€
title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Solution: recovery system handle automatically. Check: retries also failed, may need : 1. Adjust initial estimates base model 2. Simplify covariate relationship 3. Check collinearity covariates
code: # Check if retry models were created retries <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(phase == "retry")  print(retries)

title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Solution: indicates numerical issues. recovery system : 1. Create retry model different THETA sign 2. Try alternative parameterization

title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Solution: Automatically detected model marked failed.
code: # View failed models failed <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(status == "failed")  print(failed$estimation_issue)

what: Issue: No models selected in Step 2+
title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Cause: Models may meet criteria (Î”OFV RSE) Solution: Check criterion failing: Consider: - Lowering RSE threshold needed - Checking covariates correlated
code: step2_models <- search_state$search_database %>%   filter(step_number == 2, phase == "forward_selection")  # Check Î”OFV step2_models %>%   select(model_name, covariate_tested, delta_ofv, rse_max) %>%   mutate(     passes_ofv = delta_ofv > 3.84,     passes_rse = rse_max < 50   )

what: Issue: Backward elimination removes all covariates
title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Cause: Threshold low covariates truly significant Solution: Use stringent backward threshold (6.63 vs 3.84)

what: Issue: â€œCovariate not found in datasetâ€
title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Solution: Check column names match exactly:
code: # Check dataset columns names(read.csv(search_state$data_file_path))  # Check covariate config read.csv(search_state$covariate_search_path) %>%   pull(COVARIATE) %>%   unique()

title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Solution: NONMEM requires complete data. Either: 1. Impute missing values SCM 2. Exclude subjects missing covariates
code: data <- read.csv(search_state$data_file_path)  # Check for missing sapply(data, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))

title: Troubleshooting Guide
text: Solution: 1. Check cluster configuration 2. Reduce number simultaneous submissions 3. Use selective forward search instead full search
code: # Test only significant covariates from step 1 result <- run_scm_selective_forward(   search_state = search_state,   forward_threshold = 3.84 )

title: Stepwise Covariate Modeling with NONMEM/bbi Integration
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("Ollegst/CovariateSearcher")  library(CovariateSearcher)  # 1. Initialize search_state <- initialize_covariate_search(   base_model_path = "run10",   data_file_path = "data/derived/analysis.csv",   covariate_search_path = "data/covariate_search.csv",   discover_existing = TRUE,    models_folder = "models",    threads = 40)   # 2. Run SCM result <- run_automated_scm_testing(         search_state = search_state,         scm_type = "selective",                     # or "standard"       starting_phase = "backward",                # Starting phase     full_scm = TRUE,                            # Run complete workflow      forward_p_value = 0.05,                       # p-value for the forward selection        backward_p_value = 0.01,                    # p-value for the backward elimination     rse_threshold = 50,                         # RSE threshold     auto_submit = TRUE,                         # if FALSE â€“ only model creation      auto_retry = TRUE,                          # Retry model in case of failure     save_checkpoints = TRUE,                    # Save each step     checkpoint_prefix = "scm_auto",     final_testing = TRUE)                       # Test excluded covariates form failed model   # 3. Check results search_state <-readRDS("./models/scm_rds/scm_auto_final_complete.rds") results_table <- create_scm_results_table(search_state) print_scm_results_table(search_state)

title: Stepwise Covariate Modeling with NONMEM/bbi Integration
text: models/run10/run10.ctl - NONMEM control file Requirements: Format: value ; NAME ; units ; RATIO|LOG THETA Naming: Use simple names (e.g., CL, V) numbered (e.g., 1_CL, 2_V) $THETA block. Use TV_ prefix PK/PRED block.
code: $THETA ; Simple parameter names  0.5 ; CL ; L/h ; RATIO 10  ; V  ; L   ; RATIO ; OR numbered format 0.5 ; 1_CL ; L/h ; RATIO 10  ; 2_V  ; L   ; RATIO  $PK ; Use TV_ prefix in PK block for typical values TV_CL = THETA(1) TV_V  = THETA(2) CL = TV_CL * EXP(ETA(1)) V  = TV_V  * EXP(ETA(2))  $OMEGA BLOCK(2) 0.1 ; IIV_CL   ; ; LOG 0.1 ; IIV_CL_V ; ; LOG 0.1 ; IIV_V    ; ; LOG  $SIGMA 0.1 ; RUV ; ; RATIO

text: IMPORTANT: Use simple names numbered format $THETA block (TV_ prefix!) $PK block, use TV_ prefix typical values: âœ… Correct THETA naming: CL, V, KA 1_CL, 2_V, 3_KAâŒ Wrong THETA naming: TV_CL, TVCL, TVV (donâ€™t use TV_ $THETA block!)
code: $THETA ; Option 1: Simple names (recommended) (0, 0.5, 100) ; CL ; L/h ; LOG (0, 10)       ; V  ; L   ; LOG 0.5 FIX       ; KA ; 1/h ; LOG  ; Option 2: Numbered format (0, 0.5, 100) ; 1_CL ; L/h ; LOG (0, 10)       ; 2_V  ; L   ; LOG 0.5 FIX       ; 3_KA ; 1/h ; LOG $PK TV_CL = THETA(1)  ; Use TV_ prefix here TV_V  = THETA(2) TV_KA = THETA(3)  CL = TV_CL * EXP(ETA(1)) V  = TV_V  * EXP(ETA(2)) KA = TV_KA * EXP(ETA(3))

title: Resume SCM selective forward selection workflow from a saved checkpoint â€” resume_selective_forward
text: checkpoint_file Character. Path RDS file containing saved search state (e.g., "scm_selective_step_3.rds", "scm_forward_selection_complete.rds") forward_p_value Numeric. P-value forward selection significance testing. NULL, uses value search_state$search_config$forward_p_value (default: 0.05) rse_threshold Numeric. Maximum acceptable RSE threshold percentage. NULL, uses value search_state$search_config$max_rse_threshold (default: 50) auto_submit Logical. Whether automatically resubmit incomplete models found last step (default: TRUE) auto_retry Logical. Whether enable automatic retry creation failed models resubmission (default: TRUE) continue_forward Logical. Whether automatically continue forward selection possible, just load prepare state (default: TRUE)

title: Resume SCM selective forward selection workflow from a saved checkpoint â€” resume_selective_forward
text: List containing: search_state - Updated search state current model statuses status - Resume status: "ready", "ready_to_continue", "forward_complete", "no_completed_models" best_model - Current best model across completed steps best_model_step - Step number best model found best_model_ofv - OFV best model last_step - Last step number found database next_step - Suggested next step number (continuing) redemption_suggested - Whether redemption phase recommended message - Descriptive message resume status

title: Resume SCM selective forward selection workflow from a saved checkpoint â€” resume_selective_forward
text: Resume Selective Forward Selection Checkpoint function performs following operations: Loads checkpoint file validates search state structure Determines last completed step identifies incomplete models Updates model statuses NONMEM output files Optionally resubmits incomplete models auto_submit=TRUE Identifies current best model (lowest OFV) across steps Determines appropriate next action: Continue forward selection significant models exist last step Suggest redemption phase best model earlier step Mark complete significant improvements possible Provides recommendations next steps based current state

title: Resume SCM selective forward selection workflow from a saved checkpoint â€” resume_selective_forward
text: Common checkpoint files created selective forward selection: scm_selective_step_N.rds - Saved completed step scm_selective_complete.rds - Final state completion scm_redemption_N.rds - Saved redemption phase

title: Resume SCM selective forward selection workflow from a saved checkpoint â€” resume_selective_forward
text: Incomplete Models models last step still running failed, updated optionally resubmitted Continue Forward significant models exist last step best model step, forward selection can continue Redemption Phase best model earlier step, redemption testing remaining covariates suggested Complete significant models exist last step best model step, forward selection complete

title: Resume SCM selective forward selection workflow from a saved checkpoint â€” resume_selective_forward
code: if (FALSE) { # Resume from step 3 checkpoint and continue automatically result <- resume_selective_forward("scm_selective_step_3.rds") search_state <- result$search_state  # Resume with custom thresholds, just load state without continuing result <- resume_selective_forward(   checkpoint_file = "scm_selective_step_5.rds",   forward_p_value = 0.01,   rse_threshold = 40,   continue_forward = FALSE )  # Resume and resubmit incomplete models without auto-retry result <- resume_selective_forward(   checkpoint_file = "scm_selective_step_2.rds",   auto_submit = TRUE,   auto_retry = FALSE )  # Check what would happen next without actually continuing status <- resume_selective_forward(   checkpoint_file = "scm_selective_complete.rds",   continue_forward = FALSE ) cat("Status:", status$status) cat("Best model:", status$best_model) cat("Redemption suggested:", status$redemption_suggested) }

Type SCM algorithm use: "standard" - Traditional SCM testing covariates step "selective" - Selective SCM testing significant model covariates starting_phase Character. phase start : "forward" - Start forward selection (SCM) "backward" - Start backward elimination (SCM+) full_scm Logical. Whether run complete SCM workflow. TRUE: Always runs Forward selection â†’ Backward elimination (regardless starting_phase) FALSE: Runs specified starting_phase Note: True SCM always include forward backward phases (default: TRUE) forward_p_value Numeric. P-value forward selection significance testing. NULL, uses search_state$search_config$forward_p_value (default: 0.05) backward_p_value Numeric. P-value backward elimination significance testing. NULL, uses search_state$search_config$backward_p_value (default: 0.01, stringent) rse_threshold Numeric. Maximum RSE threshold percentage. NULL, uses search_state$search_config$max_rse_threshold (default: 50) auto_submit Logical. Whether automatically submit models cluster (default: TRUE) auto_retry Logical. Whether enable automatic retry failed models (default: TRUE) save_checkpoints Logical. Whether save state major step (default: TRUE) checkpoint_prefix Character. Prefix checkpoint filenames (default: "scm_auto") final_testing Logical. Whether test excluded covariates final model (default: TRUE)
